input_prompt:
Extract all factual claims from this YouTube transcript:

today's medical Centric topic is is 100% fruit juice good for you 100% fruit juice is often viewed as a healthy alternative to sugary drinks but its benefits and potential drawbacks need to be considered while it contains vitamins and nutrients drinking too much juice may have negative effects on your health one nutritional benefits of 100% fruit juice rich in vitamins vitamins and antioxidants 100% fruit juice is a good source of essential vitamins especially vitamin C which supports the immune system and potassium which helps regulate blood pressure juice also contains antioxidants which protect cells from damage nutrient absorption the vitamins and minerals and Juice can be absorbed quickly by the body making it a convenient way to get a nutritional boost hydration fluid intake since fruit juice is mostly water it helps with hydration for people who struggle to drink plain water juice can be a more palatable option two potential drawbacks of 100% fruit juice high in natural sugars fructose content even though 100% fruit juice doesn't have added sugars it still contains high amounts of naturally occurring sugar sugars like fructose these sugars can Spike blood sugar levels which may lead to insulin resistance over time calories juice is calorie dense compared to whole fruits and consuming large amounts can contribute to weight gain if not balanced with physical activity LAX fiber removed during processing one of the biggest differences between fruit juice and whole fruit is the fiber content when fruit is Juiced the fiber is removed which helps regulate blood sugar and AIDS digestion without fiber juice may cause rapid sugar absorption and hunger soon after consumption three how much is too much portion control recommended intake nutrition experts often suggest limiting fruit juice intake to one small glass per day around 4 to 6 ounces drinking juice in moderation can provide health benefits balancing diet it's essential to balance juice intake with other sources of hydration and nutrition such as water and whole fruits four alternatives to fruit juice whole fruits better nutritional value eating whole fruits provides all the vitamins and minerals found in juice along with fiber which is essential for digestion and blood sugar control whole fruits also keep you Fuller for longer diluting juice reducing sugar for those who enjoy juice dilating it with water can reduce sugar intake while still offering a refreshing taste and some nutritional benefits five long-term health effects weight gain and dental health caloric impact regularly drinking large amounts of juice can lead to excess calorie consumption contributing to weight gain over time tooth decay the sugar and Juice can contribute to cavities especially when consumed frequently throughout the day drinking juice with meals and using a straw may help reduce this risk thank you for watching our video please do not forget to like and share the video also please subscribe to the channel to stay updated on our latest videos

claims.text: 100% fruit juice is a good source of essential vitamins, especially vitamin C and potassium.
claims.context: Discussing the nutritional benefits of 100% fruit juice.

claims.text: Juice contains antioxidants which protect cells from damage.
claims.context: Mentioning the health benefits of antioxidants in juice.

claims.text: 100% fruit juice contains high amounts of naturally occurring sugars like fructose.
claims.context: Discussing the sugar content in 100% fruit juice.

claims.text: Drinking too much juice may lead to insulin resistance over time.
claims.context: Explaining potential health risks of excessive juice consumption.

claims.text: Juice is calorie dense compared to whole fruits and can contribute to weight gain.
claims.context: Discussing the caloric impact of juice versus whole fruits.

claims.text: Nutrition experts often suggest limiting fruit juice intake to one small glass per day, around 4 to 6 ounces.
claims.context: Recommendations on portion control for fruit juice consumption.

claims.text: The fiber is removed during processing of fruit juice, which helps regulate blood sugar and aids digestion.
claims.context: Highlighting the difference in fiber content between juice and whole fruit.

claims.text: Regularly drinking large amounts of juice can lead to excess calorie consumption contributing to weight gain.
claims.context: Discussing long-term health effects of juice consumption.

Return only the structured fields—no explanations.

is 100% fruit juice a good source of vitamins and potassium

context.claim_text: 100% fruit juice is a good source of essential vitamins, especially vitamin C and potassium.

input_prompt:
Claim:
100% fruit juice is a good source of essential vitamins, especially vitamin C and potassium.

Article Title:
Contribution of 100% Fruit Juice to Micronutrient Intakes ... - PubMed

Google Search Snippet:
In all three countries studied, 100% FJ contributed to more than 5% of the RDAs for vitamin C and folate. In the U.S. and Brazil, 100% FJ ...

Full Page Content:
An official website of the United States government
Back to What Is MyPlate
The Fruit Group includes all fruits and 100% fruit juice. Fruits may be fresh, frozen, canned, or dried/dehydrated. Fruits can be eaten whole, cut up, puréed (mashed), or cooked. At least half of the recommended amount of fruit eaten should come from whole fruit, rather than 100% fruit juice.
Your fruit needs depend on your age, sex, height, weight, and physical activity. This amount can also depend on whether you are pregnant or breastfeeding.
Find the right amount for you by getting your MyPlate Plan. For general guidance by age, see the table below.
In general, the following counts as 1 cup from the Fruit Group:
The table below shows amounts that count as 1 cup from the Fruit Group.
The table below shows amounts that count as 1 cup from the Fruit Group.
Note: Click on the top row to expand the table. If you are on a mobile device, you may need to turn it to see the full table.
Eating fruit has many health benefits. People who eat fruits and vegetables as part of an overall diet may lower their risk for certain diseases. Fruits provide nutrients needed to maintain your health and body.
Most fruits are low in fat, sodium, and calories. Fruits do not have cholesterol.
All food and beverage choices matter. Focus on variety, amount, and nutrition.
Do you want to know more about the foods in the Fruit Group? What does a cup or half a cup of fruit look like? Check out the Food Group Gallery! This is a great resource if you want to eat more fruits. It will also help if you want to try something new.
Blackberries, star fruits, kumquats... they’re all waiting for you in the Food Group Gallery.
